description.lang: DIN Dimmer is a DIN rail mounted dimmer for light bulbs. You can control it either remotely through the Z-Wave network or through wall switches. It also measures power consumption and supports the connection of a digital temperature sensor.
Lifeline group (reserved for communication with the main controller)
Basic on/off (triggered at change of the input I1 state and reflecting its state)
Start level change/stop level change (triggered at change of the input I1 state and reflecting its state)
Multilevel set (triggered at changes of state/value of the DIN Dimmer)
Multilevel sensor report (triggered at change of temperature sensor)
Available configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):default value 00 - mono-stable switch type (push button)1 - bi-stable switch type
Mono-stable switch type (push button)
Bi-stable switch type

name.lang: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON / ALL OFF

description.lang: DIN Dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF is not active

name.lang: Automatic turning off output after set time

description.lang: Turns off the output after set time.
Auto OFF disabled
= 1second - 32536 seconds Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 1 second

Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor.Available configuration parameters (data type is 2 Byte DEC):default value = 3253632536 = offset is 0.0C1 - 100 = value from 0.1 C to 10.0 C is added to actual measured temperature. 1001 - 1100 = value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.
Offset is 0.0 degrees Celsius
Value from 0.1 degrees Celsius to 10.0 degrees Celsius is added to actual measured temperature
Value from -0.1 degrees Celsius to 10.0 degrees Celsius to -10.0 degrees Celsius to 10.0 degrees Celsius is subtracted to actual measured temperature

name.lang: Automatic turning on output after set time

description.lang: Turns on the output after set time.
Auto ON disabled
= 1second - 32535 seconds Auto ON enabled with define time, step is 1 second

Digital temperature sensor reportingIf digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. Available configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):default value 5 = 0,5C change0 = reporting disabled1- 127 = 0,1C - 12,7C, step is 0,1C
0,5 degrees Celsius change
Reporting disabled
= 0,1 degrees Celsius - 12,7 degrees Celsius, step is 0,1 degrees Celsius
If Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum dimming value.
Double click disabled
Double click enabled

name.lang: Saving the state of the device after a power failure

description.lang: Based on the parameter settings the stores/does not store the last value of the output after power failure.
DIN Dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
DIN Dimmer module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to &amp;amp;quot;off&amp;amp;quot; position

name.lang: Power reporting in Watts on power change

description.lang: Set value means percentage, set value from 0 - 100=0% - 100%. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%.NOTE: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not send (pushed), independent of percentage set.
Reporting disabled
= 1% - 100% Reporting enabled

name.lang: Power reporting in Watts by time interval

description.lang: Set value means time interval (032767) in seconds, when power report is send. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Please note, that too fast reporting can cause too much Z-Wave traffic resulting in Z-Wave poor response.
Reporting disabled

= 1 second - 32767 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Please note, that too fast reporting can cause too much Z-Wave traffic resulting in Z-Wave poor response

With this parameter is possible to change the module presentation on the user interfaceNOTE: After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) then wait at least 30s and then re include the module!
Dimmer mode
Switch mode

The minimum level may not be higher than the maximum level! 1% min. dimming value is defined by Z-Wave multilevel device class. When the switch type is selected as Bi-stable, it is not possible to dim the value between min and max. If Switch_multilevel_set is set to the value 0, the output is turned OFF. If Switch_multilevel_set is set to the value 1, the output is set to the minimum diming value.
= 1% (minimum dimming value)
= 1% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value.

The maximum level may not be lower than the minimum level! 99% max. dimming value is defined by Z-Wave multilevel device class. When the switch type is selected as Bi-stable, it is not possible to dim the value between min and max.
= 99% (Maximum dimming value)
= 2% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value
Set value means time of moving the DIN Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I or controlled through UI (BasicSet).
= 500 mseconds - 2550 mseconds (2,55s), step is 10 mseconds
Time of moving the DIN Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continues hold of push button I or associated device.
1 second - 255 seconds

This parameter is used with association group 3.A receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0. A receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 1.
Respect start level
Ignore start level

This parameter is used with association group 3.The Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value. A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value.
Dimming duration according to parameter 66
From 1 to 127 seconds
